education.title: Reversing the Order of Operations
education.misconception: Students often incorrectly apply the order of operations (PEMDAS) when solving equations.
education.why_wrong: This leads to errors in calculations and can be frustrating for students.
education.correct_model: The correct application of PEMDAS: Parentheses, Exponents, Multiplication and Division (from left to right), Addition and Subtraction (from left to right).
education.classroom_move: Write a simple equation on the board and ask students to solve it using the incorrect order of operations. Then, reveal the correct solution and have students work in pairs to solve another equation with the correct application of PEMDAS.
exit_questions: What is the first step in applying PEMDAS?
Can you think of a scenario where the order of operations might not matter?
